articles.headline: Norway Keeps Nest Egg From Some U.S. Companies
articles.snippet: After amassing a fortune in excess of $300 billion over the last decade, Norway has started pulling investments for what it claims are ethical failings.
articles.abstract: After amassing a fortune in excess of $300 billion over the last decade, Norway has started pulling investments for what it claims are ethical failings.
articles.lead_paragraph: OSLO — For a people whose deep national pride is in bestowing the Nobel Peace Prize, Norwegians are developing a reputation for throwing some sharp elbows.

articles.headline: In Jihadist Haven, a Goal: To Kill and Die in Iraq
articles.snippet: Zarqa, Jordan, known as a cradle of Islamic militancy, is now a breeding ground for would-be jihadists.
articles.abstract: Zarqa, Jordan, known as a cradle of Islamic militancy, is now a breeding ground for would-be jihadists.
articles.lead_paragraph: ZARQA, Jordan — Abu Ibrahim considers his dead friends the lucky ones.
articles.byline: By Souad Mekhennet and Michael Moss

articles.headline: Big Names, Big Wallets, Big Cause
articles.snippet: Even in charity, the titans of hedge funds and private equity do nothing small.
articles.abstract: Even in charity, the titans of hedge funds and private equity do nothing small.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even in charity, the titans of hedge funds and private equity do nothing small.

articles.headline: Murdoch on Owning The Wall Street Journal
articles.snippet: Rupert Murdoch shared his opinions on The Wall Street Journal and on the family that owns the company.
articles.abstract: Rupert Murdoch shared his opinions on The Wall Street Journal and on the family that owns the company.
articles.lead_paragraph: Like any close reader of The Wall Street Journal, Rupert Murdoch has his opinions.
articles.byline: By Richard Siklos and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Seeking an Edge, Florida Changes Its Primary Date
articles.snippet: Officials in other states said Florida’s move would only create more chaos around the nominating process.
articles.abstract: Officials in other states said Florida’s move would only create more chaos around the nominating process.
articles.lead_paragraph: MIAMI, May 3 — Casting more uncertainty over the presidential nominating process for 2008, the Florida Legislature on Thursday moved the state’s primary up to Jan. 29, ignoring the threat of sanctions from the national Republican and Democratic parties.

articles.headline: U.S. Officials Meet Briefly With Iranians
articles.snippet: There was a rare direct conversation between representatives of the two antagonistic nations today at a conference on Iraq.
articles.abstract: There was a rare direct conversation between representatives of the two antagonistic nations today at a conference on Iraq.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHARM EL SHEIK, Egypt, May 4 — American and Iranian officials spoke briefly today at a regional conference here on the Iraq situation, in a rare direct conversation between representatives of the two antagonistic nations.
articles.byline: By Helene Cooper and Jon Elsen

articles.headline: Should S.E.C. Act Against Lawyers?
articles.snippet: If you are going to commit fraud, you may need a good lawyer. In some cases, you have to have a lawyer to pull off the fraud at all.
articles.abstract: If you are going to commit fraud, you may need a good lawyer. In some cases, you have to have a lawyer to pull off the fraud at all.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you are going to commit fraud, you may need a good lawyer. In some cases, you have to have a lawyer to pull off the fraud at all.

articles.headline: Next Venture From Stewart: Costco Food
articles.snippet: The long, fastidious reach of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia now extends to perhaps the riskiest industry of all: groceries.
articles.abstract: The long, fastidious reach of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia now extends to perhaps the riskiest industry of all: groceries.
articles.lead_paragraph: The long, fastidious reach of Martha Stewart Living Omnimedia extends into the magazine, television, furniture, bedding, paint, glassware, and even home building businesses.

articles.headline: Wall St. Banker Jailed in Trading on 9 Deals
articles.snippet: The banker is charged with illegally leaking confidential information on nine deals, including the $45 billion buyout of the Texas energy giant TXU.
articles.abstract: The banker is charged with illegally leaking confidential information on nine deals, including the $45 billion buyout of the Texas energy giant TXU.
articles.lead_paragraph: Federal authorities arrested an investment banker yesterday and charged him with illegally leaking confidential information on nine deals, including the $45 billion buyout of the Texas energy giant TXU.
